title: IT Specialist (Security)
division: U.S. Army Acquisition Support Center, Program Executive Office, Command Control Communications-Tactical Network (PEO C3T), PMO I2S
summary: This is a Direct Hire Authority (DHA) solicitation utilizing the DHA for AcqDemo Business and Technical Management Career Path (NH) to recruit and appoint qualified candidates to positions in the competitive service. About the Position This IT Specialist (Security) position is assigned to the Program Executive Office, Command Control Communications-Tactical Network (PEO C3T), PMO I2S, located in Aberdeen Proving Ground, MD.
duties: Serves as technical expert working with Identity, Credential and Access Management (ICAM) Stakeholders to enable the Army Zero Trust Architecture through planning, designing, requirements mapping and integration of hardware/software systems. Maintains knowledge of existing and new advancements in ICAM technology (e.g Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA), Identity Providers (IdPs), Privileged Access Management (PAM), Fast Identity Online (FIDO) and Client to Authenticator Protocols (CTAP). Leads a multi-disciplinary team of technical experts/engineers/scientists to plan, design, develop and test Army ICAM related projects. Assist Program Managers in aligning cybersecurity roadmaps and plans to Army ICAM requirements and delivery schedule. Documents and prepares factual and analytical reports WRT ICAM testing requirements. Monitor programs and acquisition documentation related to systems engineering for executability and compliance with established program decisions, ICAM Requirements, policies, cybersecurity, and Zero Trust Policies. Engages with product owners, cybersecurity staff and customer organizations concerning architecture, concepts, and developments of new or changed cybersecurity measures that pertain to ICAM.
specialized: 1) Analyzes new and existing security systems to verify they meet the security requirements; 2) Analyzes data and prepares recurring reports to ensure issues are resolved for security systems; and 3) Prepares and presents briefings for the organization.

title: Cyber Security Specialist (ASA)
division: Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO), Information Assurance Services (IAS), Security Engineering and Architecture Branch
summary: This position is located in the U.S. Department of Education, Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO), Information Assurance Services (IAS), Security Engineering and Architecture Branch in Washington, DC. This position ensures the development and implementation of Identity, Credential, and Access Management (ICAM) Program.
duties: As a Cyber Security Specialist, GS-2210, you will be responsible for As Cybersecurity ICAM Program Manager (PM), analyzes complex, ambiguous, and often conflicting information, establishes and manages a successful implementation and operation of Identity, Credential, and Access Management (ICAM) Program and Service in the Department of Education. Serves as senior expert and consultant to top agency management officials to advise on integrating the Cybersecurity ICAM program with other programs of equivalent scope and complexity. Works with differing groups across multiple business units. Assures the consumption of enterprise OCIO ICAM services as part of portfolio of other Information Assurance Services (IAS) cybersecurity services such as, but not limited to, Zero Trust Architecture (ZTA), Information Security Continuous Monitoring (ISCM), Continuous Diagnostics and Mitigation (COM) and Cyber Data Lake (CDL). Establishes Cybersecurity ICAM practices, templates, policies, tools, and partnerships to expand and mature capabilities for the organization to increase Inspector General (IG) maturity metric scores and Federal Information Security Modernization Act (FISMA) scores to the highest scores possible. Supports the remediation of Cybersecurity FISMA ICAM audit findings by managing the timely completion of corrective action plans (CAPs). Manages risks and issues and takes corrective measurements. Contributes to process improvement as it relates to improving delivery of enterprise ICAM program services for Department consumption. Works creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment demonstrating teamwork, innovation, and excellence. Reports on ICAM project success criteria results, metrics, tests, and deployment management activities. Manages ongoing quality control and participates in quality issue resolution. Determines the frequency and content of status reports from the ICAM project and program team, analyzes results and troubleshoots problem areas. Ensures progress towards achieving the adoption and execution of Project Management Body of Knowledge (PMBOK) Tier Ill program management office equivalent and service delivery functions for ICAM. Leads and defines the ICAM program governance (controls) and reporting of progress. Manages resources, schedules, financial operations and adheres to the goals set forth by the agency, with quality control guidelines throughout the ICAM program development life cycle. Ensures all ICAM budget, investment, reporting, contracts, lnteragency Agreement (IAA) and administrative functions are completed accurately, thoroughly, and timely. Defines the ICAM Statement of Work and Specifications for requested goods and services. Provides status reporting regarding ICAM project milestones, deliverables, dependencies, risks, and issues, communicating across leadership. Develops and manages all aspects of ICAM project and program engagement from planning, external vendor relationships, communications, resources, budget, changes, risks, and issues. Tasks contact personnel assigned to support assigned initiatives and works closely with management to ensure ICAM project deliverables are met while security and engineering operations continue to function. Leads, manages, and implements the ICAM initiatives at the Department of Education. Establishes ICAM working groups, committees, and tiger teams to ensure full engagement of Department stakeholders. Identifies and develops trusted adviser relationships with ICAM project and program stakeholders, sponsors, and the Department stakeholders.
specialized: 1. Experience leading implementation of Tier-Three Program Management Office (PMO) to develop and deliver organization-wide Identity, Credential, and Access Management (ICAM), Cybersecurity and Information Technology services. 2. Experience serving as a senior level expert and advisor on critical issues in the field of Cybersecurity, ICAM and Information Technology services. 3. Experience utilizing complex Cybersecurity theories, principles, concepts, standards, and practices to conceptualize and implement new initiatives across business and technology organizations.

title: Supervisory IT Specialist (INFOSEC)
division: Departmental Offices (DO), Assistant Secretary for Management/CFO, DAS Information Systems & CIO, ACIO Infrastructure & Operations (IO), Enterprise Networks
summary: This position is located at Departmental Offices, Assistant Secretary for Management/CFO, DAS Information Systems & CIO, ACIO Infrastructure & Operations (IO), Enterprise Networks. As a Supervisory IT Specialist (INFOSEC), you will be responsible for the policy, operations, and oversight of a wide range of IT infrastructure including telecommunications services for Treasury offices and Bureaus.
duties: As a Supervisory IT Specialist (INFOSEC), you will Serve as a subject matter expert on information technology issues related to security for telecommunications, data, voice, and video, ICAM, and cloud technologies. Act as the primary liaison for the Director, Enterprise Infrastructure Cybersecurity with other entities in the information security community. Manage a staff of security specialists performing duties on multiple projects and programs within the Department. Express ideas and facts to individuals or groups effectively; make clear and convincing oral presentations; listen to others; facilitate an open exchange of ideas. Make sound and well-informed decisions; perceive the impact and implications of decisions; commit to action, even in uncertain situations, in order to accomplish organizational goals; cause change.
specialized: Developing, defining, managing and documenting cyber projects; AND Using project management tools and skills to develop and manage in-depth cybersecurity projects plans; AND Applying Federal information systems security protocols to integrate information systems security with other security disciplines; AND eveloping, implementing and interpreting metrics for the evaluation of cybersecurity program effectiveness and efficiency

title: IT Cybersecurity Specialist
division: Office of the Secretary of the Interior, Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO), Cybersecurity Division (CSD)
summary: This position is part of the Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO), Cybersecurity Division (CSD). The incumbent is responsible for the development, implementation, coordination, and enforcement of cybersecurity policies and procedures relating to Identity and Access Management. Other activities include the management of a wide range of IT Portfolios and projects related to information systems and cybersecurity matters.
duties: Lead discussions to interface ICAM services with other key programs, including Zero Trust Architecture. Develop ICAM Policies and procedures and develop ICAM Audit program to measure compliance. Manage ICAM Budget planning and execution. Manage ICAM Communication and Training Program. Exhibit skills in collaboration/partnership, conflict management, influencing/negotiation, leadership and mentorship. Develop procedures to standardize customer service by engaging customers to manage expectations, provide requested services in a helpful and courteous manner, maintain readily available guidance for customers to increase awareness of ICAM Services, and provide timely recommendations, assistance and support to requests and questions. Develop customer intake and change management procedures and policies to onboard and manage customer use of ICAM Services. Develop Standard Operating Procedures, budget estimates, and schedules for implementing new ICAM Services. Oversee development of marketing materials for new ICAM Services.
specialized: Leading implementation, operations, and management of Identity, Credential, and Access Management (ICAM) systems, ensuring robust security measures. Developing and enforcing policies to govern access controls, authentication, and authorization processes. Collaborating with cross-functional teams to integrate ICAM solutions, enhancing overall cybersecurity posture. Streamlining user provisioning and de-provisioning workflows, optimizing operational efficiency in a dynamic environment. Experience with Fed PKI operations, Personal Identity Verification (PIV) card and certificates for secure access to systems/facilities, Zero Trust (ZT), CISA's Continuous Diagnostics and Mitigation (CDM) program, and risk-based access management practices (including environment attributes and user behavioral analytics).

title: Human Resources Specialist (Military)
division: Department of the Army, U.S. Army Human Resources Command (DRU), The Adjutant General Directorate (TAGD)
summary: This position is assigned to The Adjutant General Division (TAGD) in the U.S. Human Resources Command (USAHRC). The incumbent serves as the Assistant Army Project Officer and leads a team in the Army Project Office (APO) for Defense Enrollment Eligibility Reporting System (DEERS) and the Real-Time Automated Personnel Identification System (RAPIDS).
duties: Establishes operating guidelines to implement procedures, methods, and other work-related changes; improves operating effectiveness or correct problems. Determines work priorities and assigns DEERS/RAPIDS work to employees based on selective consideration of such factors as difficulty/requirements of assignments, available resources, and the capabilities and/or special qualifications of employees. Uses individual initiative, personal judgment, and knowledge in presenting a course of action that will bring the case to successful completion for PO approval. Operates DEERS/RAPIDS as the Army's technical and policy expert and presents recommendations to APO for decision impacting all Army identification card issuing facilities worldwide. Researches, identifies and resolves necessary changes to database files in a timely manner. Identifies shortcomings with new software, and recommends updates to software developers for incorporation to future updates. Writes articles for publication in periodicals such as Army TASS Newsletter, DEERS/RAPIDS Newsletter, Army ECHOS, and any Public Affairs information that is required. As the Assistant Project Officer, DEERS/RAPIDS, the incumbent conducts research for various investigations or projects assigned by the Army Project Officer. Composes responses for the PO to determine final actions to be taken with regard to their respective individual circumstances.
specialized: Specialized experience is defined as one year of specialized experience equivalent to the GS-11 grade level in the Federal service which includes work that involves: investigating a variety of problems/inquiries related to determination of eligibility for service-related CAC Card entitlements, benefits, and privileges in association with programs such as DEERS, MP ICAM (previously known as TASS), RAPIDS, etc. Analyzing facts obtained and determining course of action necessary to resolve cases. Acknowledging receipt of inquiries and conducting research of correspondence, reports of previous inquiries, and previous cases. Assisting with analyzing, investigating, and advising DOD agencies and the DOD program offices regarding emerging technologies, changing policies/laws, requirements for equipment, software changes and development, and the status of world-wide fielding in areas such as DEERS, MP ICAM, RAPIDS, and CAC cards.

title: Information Technology Specialist
division: Administrative Office of the U.S. Courts, Department of Technology Services (DTS), Systems Development and Support Office (SDSO)
summary: This position is located in the Department of Technology Services (DTS), Systems Development and Support Office (SDSO).
duties: The Full Stack Identity Architect is pivotal in designing, building, and maintaining the Judiciary's Identity, Credential, and Access Management systems. This role encompasses tasks in software development, integration, project management, and architectural design tailored for the Judiciary's unique needs across on-prem and cloud environments. They will be a part of the Administrative Office of the U.S. Courts (AO), which provides a range of services to federal courts. Duties may include but are not limited to Architecting, designing, and ensuring the implementation of robust ICAM solutions tailored for the Judiciary's unique needs both on-premise and in cloud-based multi-tenant environments. Collaborating with diverse teams to gather and consolidate ICAM requirements. Coordinating with software developers and IT specialists for the seamless integration of ICAM solutions. Supporting the Judiciary by providing technical product documentation. Ensuring all ICAM solutions are secure, resilient, and adhere to approved policies. Ensuring all ICAM solutions have appropriate levels of security, resilience, replication, disaster recovery, and adherence to approved Change, Configuration, and Release Management policies.
specialized: Applicants must have at least one full year (52 weeks) of specialized experience which is in or directly related to the line of work of this position. Specialized experience is demonstrated experience in ALL of the following (1) Create standard IdAM practices and take charge of build and development decisions, infrastructure and systems solutions to identity related problems that meet both security and operational objectives; AND (2) Execute detail design tasks, create associated work and advise on right-sizing decisions for infrastructure, software solutions, and services. (Your resume must show clear and convincing evidence of all areas of specialized experience.) Desirable but not required. Experience with RESTful APIs, microservices, and message-based architectures. Experience with cloud technologies such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform. Strong software development skills in Java, C#, or Python. Strong project management skills. Experience with the federal Judiciary is a plus.

title: Operations Officer
division: Department of the Army, U.S. Army Acquisitions Support Center, Program Executive Office, Command Control Communications-Tactical (PEO C3T)
summary: This Operations Officer position is assigned to the Product Lead for Enterprise- Identity Credential and Access Management (E-ICAM), within Program Executive Office, Command, Control, Communications - Tactical (PEO C3T) and located at Fort Belvoir, Virginia.
duties: Exercises delegated authority and broad responsibility for planning and administering all technical and operational aspects of management support functions. Serves as the Chief of the Operations Office. Initiates and develops program plans and investigates approaches with broad authority and minimal direction for planning and administering the assigned responsibilities. Oversees projects, programs, and assigned functions. Directs work which includes complex administrative or technical services that directly affect the organization as a whole or represent a major segment of a program critical to the organization’s mission.
specialized: One year of specialized experience which includes:1) Develops plans and investigates methods with authority and minimal direction for administering the assigned functional responsibilities; 2) Utilizes appropriate data collection techniques for work reviewed; 3) Approving expenses associated with the purchase of goods and services. This definition of specialized experience is typical of work performed at the next lower grade/level position in the federal service (NH-02 or GS-11).

title: Supervisory IT Specialist (PLCYPLN)
division: International Trade Administration, Office of the Undersecretary, Office of the Chief Information Officer
summary: This vacancy is for a Supervisory IT Specialist (PLCYPLN) in the International Trade Administration within the Department of Commerce.
duties: As a Supervisory IT Specialist (PLCYPLN), you will perform the following duties Serve as senior expert and consultant to top agency management officials providing authoritative advice and guidance related to the ITA IT policy. Provide program management services including policy formulation and adoption, budget formulation and compliance, capital planning, strategic planning, establishment of program performance metrics and reporting. Supervise staff, plan work and determine priorities in allocating resources; evaluate staff performance and provide counseling and instruction to subordinate staff. Prepare, present and and implement OCIO's strategic plan; and present briefings to senior management on policy and strategic planning programs. Provides credible, cogent, and timely advice and counsel to the Chief Information Officer and other ITA senior management on programmatic, infrastructure, and administrative aspects of policy and strategic planning.
specialized: You must possess one full year (52 weeks) of specialized experience equivalent to the GS-14 in the Federal service performing the following work Oversight of an Information Technology (IT) Program, including leading teams and/or supervising IT staff. Serving as a leading technical (IT) expert performing planning, organizing, and directing the service delivery of an IT Program and/or related services. Interpreting, developing, and implementing information system policies and procedures, i.e., in Technology Business Management (TBM); Federal Identity, Credential, and Access Management (ICAM ); and Enterprise Architecture and framework and Homeland Security Presidential Directive 12 (HSPD-12). Communicating technical information to a wide range of audiences, including the most senior agency and/or organization officials. Oversight and responsibility for IT-related budget formulation, compliance, and risk management.

division: Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO), Information Assurance Services (IAS)

This position is located in the U.S. Department of Education, Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO), Information Assurance Services (IAS) in Washington, DC. This position ensures the development and implementation of Identity, Credential, and Access Management (ICAM) Program.

Ability to research best practices within and outside the organization to establish benchmark data and use continuous process improvement disciplines to achieve results. 4. Skill in leading, motivating and managing various projects and programs, including internal and external resources. 5. Ability to effectively communicate orally and in writing and achieve effective interface and interchange with technical and professional colleagues, including industry partners and executive sponsors.

title: Information Technology Specialist
division: Administrative Office of the U.S. Courts, Department of Technology Services (DTS), Systems Development and Support Office (SDSO), Software Infrastructure Division (SID), Directory Services Branch (DSB)
summary: This position is located in the Department of Technology Services (DTS), Systems Development and Support Office (SDSO), Software Infrastructure Division (SID), Directory Services Branch (DSB) in Washington, DC.
duties: Given the substantial user base includes over 35,000 judiciary users and 3.2 million public users, the incumbent will be a hands-on technical leader. Collaborating closely with peers and various departments, you will play a key role in shaping and implementing a multi-cloud hybrid Identity, Credential, and Access Management (ICAM) environment. We seek a candidate with a distinguished track record that speaks volumes about their ability to acquire and share knowledge through hands-on cross-training with fellow team members. The successful candidate will demonstrate dedication to collaborative growth and the mutual enrichment of shared expertise. Duties of the position include, but are not limited to Installing, configuring, administrating, fine-tuning, and resolving challenges associated with IBM Security Verify Governance / Identity Manager. Guiding installation procedures, implementing automation strategies, managing clusters, applying patches, executing backups, and overseeing various administrative functions. Creating and modifying workflows. Performing Python and Bash programming to optimize the technology stack. Crafting provisioning policies and implementing joiner, mover, and leaver functionalities. Establishing robust security protocols encompassing vital areas like Web Access Management, federation, cross-domain authentication, multifactor authentication, and cutting-edge authentication/authorization technologies.
specialized: Applicants must have at least one full year (52 weeks) of specialized experience which is in or directly related to the line of work of this position. Specialized experience is demonstrated history of providing comprehensive enterprise administrative support for the IBM Security Verify suite.

title: Program Manager (PACS)
division: Departmental Offices
summary: This position is located at Departmental Offices,Management CFO- Info Systems and CIO. As a Program Manager (PACS), you will serve as the Physical Access Control Systems (PACS) Program Manager for the Department of the Treasury and are responsible for the implementation of HSPD-12 PACS.
duties: As a Program Manager (PACS), you will Serve as the agency expert on Homeland Security Presidential Directive (HSPD-12), FIPS-201, SP 800-116, Federal Identity Credential & Access Management (FICAM), and other regulations associated with PACS. Develop plans and set priorities for Treasury to successfully implement and ensure compliance with HSPD-12 requirements and federal guidance. Provide guidance and technical direction for the implementation of HSPD-12 requirements for both PIV card issuance and PACS upgrades. Manage the development of policies and operational procedures for Department-wide PACS. Oversee the development of objectives, prioritize requirements, and document the funding justification for PACS budgeting.
specialized: For the GS-15, you must have one year of specialized experience at a level of difficulty and responsibility equivalent to the GS-14 grade level in the Federal service. Specialized Experience for this position includes Monitoring program compliance to requirements, regulations, or established performance levels; AND Experience with program analysis, including the experience guiding and structuring work and understanding large quantities of information and the production of a wide variety of written materials; AND Serving as a Physical Access Control Systems (PACS) Program Manager and experience with Identity, Credential and Access Management (ICAM), gained either in the public or private sector; AND Participating as a team leader on interdisciplinary project teams.

title: SUPV IT SPECIALIST (PLCYPLN)
division: Defense Technical Information Center (DTIC), Directorate of Project Management
summary: The Defense Technical Information Center (DTIC) is the central facility for the acquisition, preservation, protection, retrieval, and dissemination of scientific and technical information supporting the Research and Engineering (R&E) needs of the Department of Defense, as well as federal and industry partners. DTIC ensures the innovation and knowledge stemming from DoD's past and current investment in science and technology (S&T) forms the building blocks for the next generation of discovery.
duties: Serves as Chief Technology Officer (CTO) for the Defense Technical Information Center (DTIC) with responsibility for the overall analysis and integration of existing and emerging technologies to advance DTIC mission capabilities. Prepares and executes briefings (formal and informal/ad hoc) to senior leaders on key topics. Represents Directorate and Center at conferences, working groups, meetings, and fora. Advises the Chief Information Officer and senior staff on technology integration to meet mission requirements efficiently and securely. Communicates with DTIC internal and external user community to facilitate integration and evaluation of technologies into existing systems or new programs. Serves as the Division Chief for Software Development, a principal member of the Directorate management staff. Plans, directs and coordinates the activities of the Division. Coordinates and directs Division resources for effective accomplishment of the DTIC mission. Leads and influences various groups or persons to reach consensus on the viability and utility of various technologies. Ensures the information systems are operated, used, maintained, and disposed of in accordance with security policies and best practices.
specialized: One year of specialized experience equivalent in level of difficulty and responsibility to that of the next lower grade GS-14 within the federal service, which demonstrates the ability to perform the duties of the position, is required. Specialized experience is defined as experience leading a project or team or serving as a subject matter expert applying knowledge of online product delivery and support principles and approaches that involved business process improvement; product rationalization; business requirements management; data architectures and strategies aligned to DoD data strategy; and organizational change management resulting in change in technology and business operations; Specialized experience also includes applying knowledge in all of the following areas: Setting up and operating in the Azure environment, Agile development, DevSecOps, Docker and Kubernetes, metadata extraction; ICAM integration; Java, Angular, NodeJS, C++, JavaScript; Python, Ruby; JIRA, Maven; Fortify, development security principles, Elastic, Confluence, API management, and cloud design principles.

title: Lead IT Specialist (INFOSEC)
division: Bureau of the Fiscal Service, Information & Security Services (ISS), Identity Credentialing & Access Management (ICAM) Division, Authentication Service Branch
summary: The position is located at the Bureau of the Fiscal Service, Information & Security Services (ISS), Identity Credentialing & Access Management (ICAM) Division, Authentication Service Branch, serving as a team leader, assuring work assignments of the team are carried out according to the manager's instructions regarding priorities, deadlines, and quality.
duties: As an Lead IT Specialist (INFOSEC), you will Ensure that the organization's strategic plan, mission, vision, and values are communicated to the team and integrated into the team's strategies, goals, objectives, work plans, and work products and services. Articulate and communicate to the team the assignment, project, problem to be solved, actionable events, milestones, priorities, and/or program issues under review, and deadlines and time frames for completion. Provide expert leadership and skill in applying advanced IT principles, concepts, methods, standards, and practices sufficient to accomplish assignments related to the prevention and defense against unauthorized access to systems, networks, and data in addition to the development and operation of Fiscal Service's Identity, Credentialing and Access Management (ICAM) security hardware, operating systems, and/or application software. Serve as an expert on Identity, Credentialing and Access Management (ICAM) security technologies. This includes researching, engineering, acquiring, testing, and implementing tools and techniques for implementing, monitoring, operating, and maintaining advanced hardware and/or software systems. Coach the team in the selection and application of appropriate problem solving methods and techniques; provide advice on work methods, practices, and procedures; and assist the team and/or individual members in identifying the parameters of a viable solution.
specialized: For the GS-13, you must have one year of specialized experience at a level of difficulty and responsibility at the GS-12 level in the Federal service or equivalent, which have equipped the candidate with the particular knowledge, skills, and abilities to successfully perform the duties of the position. Specialized experience for this position includes experience performing IT work that involves planning, leading, or developing assignments, and directing or leading administrative and technical IT projects and programs in order to support technologies, operations, applications, and activities within the Branch. For the GS-13, examples of such experience could include Experience leading a team for IT related projects. OR Experience in the technical planning, engineering, deployment, and support of IT systems; OR Experience as an administrator of IT systems or devices with a wide range of server OS (Operating System), software, management, and remote support technologies and techniques at the Tier 3 or 4 support levels.; OR Providing liaison, recommendations and technical information between an organization and customers.

title: IT Specialist (INFOSEC)
division: Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO), Office of the Chief Information Security Officer (OCISO), ICAM Shared Services Division
summary: n/a
duties: The Identity Credential, and Access Management (ICAM) Shared Service Division supports consolidating Identity Credential, and Access Management-related capabilities to focus on improving ICAM coordination and governance across GSA IT and development/delivery of enterprise certificate and key management capabilities. As an IT Specialist (INFOSEC) you will perform the following duties Manage the C-SCRM Program within the ICAM Shared Services Division, including development of any related policies, procedures, and processes. Lead activities of the C-SCRM program, including overseeing any related project activities and coordinating with associated stakeholders related to GSA IT acquisitions and GSA systems. Conduct analysis, monitoring, and reporting on C-SCRM risks for GSA systems and products. Performs comprehensive cybersecurity, vendor and supply chain risk assessments for critical suppliers and pre-award acquisitions. Develops and recommends technical solutions and provides guidance on IT security implementation to federal agency customers. Perform research and analysis of standard commercial practices to identify new technologies, etc., for use with GSA systems, as well as identify external business factors that might influence or critically impact the operation of GSA systems.
specialized: Specialized experience is experience in assisting with the planning, development and maintenance of an IT Security program in accordance with the Federal Information Security Management Act (FISMA).

title: Security Specialist (Direct Hire)
division: Lyndon B. Johnson Space Center
summary: Serves as a Security Specialist at Johnson Space Center in the areas of Physical Security, Identity and Credential Management (ICAM), Communication Security (COMSEC), Industrial Security, and Classified National Security Information (CNSI).
duties: Duties described below are at the highest grade advertised. Duties assigned at lower grade levels will be of more limited scope, performed with less independence and limited complexity; duties will be commensurate with the grade of selected employee. Protects NASA property and individuals from threats or adversarial influences by carrying out physical security countermeasures designed to protect personnel from potential threats. Prevents unauthorized access to equipment, facilities, materials, and documents while safeguarding NASA assets against damage and theft. Implements NASA physical security requirements by conducting facility security assessments, effecting appropriate levels of protection while providing Center organizations with guidance on meeting physical security requirements. Serves as the alternate COMSEC (Communications Security) Account Manager (CAM) handling, controlling, and safeguarding sensitive COMSEC material and encryption equipment while supporting investigations of COMSEC incidents, and audits. Supports Industrial Security processes for classification and clearance levels required for contract performance; product classification; and access to communications security, intelligence, or international organization information. Supports the Center's Classified National Security Information (CNSI) program by following policies, instructions, and procedures for classification and declassification authorities in the physical storage, safeguarding, and control of documents. Supports the Identity, Credentialing, and Access Control Management (ICAM) program by authorizing credentials, conducting background checks, and managing tour accesses. Fosters a culture of engagement, diversity, inclusiveness, excellence and innovation. Champions NASAs commitment to Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Accessibility to create an environment that promotes a commitment to safety, integrity, and teamwork.

title: IT Specialist (INFOSEC)
division: Fiscal Service (FS), DAC Infrastructure and Operations, Identity Credentialing & Access Management Division (ICAMD)
summary: The position is an IT Specialist in the Bureau of Fiscal Service (FS), DAC Infrastructure and Operations, Identity Credentialing & Access Management Division (ICAMD), branch as assigned, serving as an expert on all ICAM services such as Single Sign-On (SSO), Public Key Infrastructure (PKI), Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP), and Identity Management.
duties: As an IT Specialist (ENTARCH/INFOSEC), you will Serve as the Fiscal Service expert regarding the Bureau's enterprise ICAM services such as Single Sign-On (SSO), Public Key Infrastructure (PKI), Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP), or Identity Management infrastructures and as such, interface with Fiscal Service, Treasury and Treasury agencies, Federal Reserve and franchise customer personnel on matters relating to this area. Engineer and propose new designs for the Fiscal Service enterprise ICAM services of SSO, PKI, LDAP, or Identity Management architecture to meet Presidential, Office of Management and Budget (OMB), and Departmental requirements. Defend those designs when scrutinized by agency and bureau heads and their staff. Once successfully defended, build and maintain the architecture to designed specifications. Ensure the architecture successfully meets or exceeds the functionality and security specifications required. Provide in-depth trouble-shooting support to ISS and other organizations and agencies regarding enterprise ICAM services of SSO, PKI, LDAP, or Identity Management hardware, software and computer operations. Work with Department of Homeland Security (DHS), the Department, and Bureau heads and staff to review and update policy, regulatory and procedural material in order to assess the impact on existing enterprise ICAM services of SSO, PKI, LDAP, or Identity Management hardware, software, and systems, as well as the effects on the planning process. These policies and regulations impact enterprise ICAM service and related programs throughout Treasury, Treasury Bureaus, and in some instances all Federal Government. Develop policies, standards and standard operating procedures required for the implementation of Fiscal Service's enterprise ICAM services of SSO, PKI, LDAP, or Identity Management architecture which directly impacts programs throughout Treasury, Treasury Bureaus, and in some instances all Federal Government. Develop long-range configuration and conversion plans to assure continuity of enterprise ICAM services as new equipment and systems are phased in.
specialized: For the GS-13, you must have one year of specialized experience at a level of difficulty and responsibility at the GS-12 level in the Federal service or equivalent, which have equipped the candidate with the particular knowledge, skills, and abilities to successfully perform the duties of the position. Specialized experience for this position includes experience performing Information Technology (IT) work that involves ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of systems, networks, and data through analysis, planning, design, implementation, and troubleshooting of enterprise structural frameworks in order to meet goals and needs of an organization. Examples of such experience could include Tier 3 or 4 equivalent level experience in Identity Credentialing and Access Management (ICAM) services; OR Tier 3 of 4 equivalent level experience designing, engineering, and deploying custom IT systems covering a wide range of server OS( Operating System), software, management, and remote support technologies and techniques.

title: INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY SPECIALIST
division: Office of the Executive Director (OED), Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO)
summary: This position is located in the Federal Trade Commission's Office of the Executive Director (OED), Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO). The Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO) oversees all IT services in support of the FTC's mission and strategic plan.
duties: The employee manages and monitors several services that comprise an end-to-end customer experience and regularly solicits and reviews stakeholder feedback and use of those services to identify opportunities for improved customer satisfaction and compliance with FTC policies and procedures. The employee researches controls that affect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of IT services and business requirements that affect the customer's satisfaction with IT services, develops multiple alternatives for management's consideration based on that research, makes a data driven recommendation, implements the recommended alternative, and maintains ongoing operations on approval from upper management. The employee's research and recommendations are influenced by best practices for eDiscovery, Federal Civil Rules of Procedure, Rules of Practice and the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA). Alternatives can include actions that change current practices for strategy, acquisitions, budget, planning, governance or the technology itself that support an IT service and often encompass activities outside the immediate organization and outside OCIO. In addition, employee can develop alternatives in coordination with upper management that require anticipation of future FTC or government wide policies, procedures, and demands of IT services. Research, resulting alternatives, implementation, and ongoing operations of recommended alternative should reflect a level of attention to detail such that peers and supervisors can independently verify completion and thoroughness of completed work through use of FTC data such as that for budgets, acquisitions, governance, performance management, enterprise architecture, and customer feedback. Peers and supervisors within the immediate organization can use information discovered and shared through completed work to support quantitative trade-off considerations for senior decision makers. Each proposed alternative should reflect a complete solution that can include but is not limited to On the basis of general design criteria provided, develop and deploy modifications to parts of a system that required significant revisions in the logic or techniques used in the original development. Identification of system interrelationships to inform considerations for security and information management. Sequencing of activities necessary to complete implementation of any recommendation through consultation with peers and customers. Management actions that impact activities related to governance, budgeting, contracting and general resource allocation. Anticipation of industry trends that affect FTC and government wide policies and procedures related to IT service delivery (ex: cloud services, data center consolidation, cybersecurity standards, government wide acquisition vehicles, FEDRAMP, etc.). Based on the level of expertise demonstrated in the research, development of alternatives, and outcomes of the implementation, and anticipation of industry trends, the supervisor may assign the employee tasks that require coordination with upper management and across customer groups to design integrated services that enhance the user experience in support of the FTC mission. In addition, the Microsoft 365 (M365) SME is expected to provide expertise in Microsoft 365 architectural design, development, implementation and management and provide guidance on the performance impact of the architecture. Understands and assists with enhancing IT customer communication and collaboration migrations in accordance with agreed upon service agreements. Incumbent would also be responsible for aligning M365 technology solutions with business strategies. The incumbent would perform technical oversight of implementation projects to assure alignment with architecture and technology standards and develop future strategies for M365 products and services. Designs, plans and performs Microsoft Exchange and 365 migrations. Proven design, planning and implementation experience with Microsoft Teams and SharePoint Online Experience. Responsible for leadership and delivery of project based assignments that encompass system architecture, proof-of-concept and deployment services. Facilitate and lead client configuration planning meetings and articulate pros & cons of design/architecture decision across a wide spectrum of factors - e.g. latency, storage, startup/shutdown. Strong customer relationship skills and willingness to lead customers through successful challenging projects which includes estimating, developing Performance Work Statements and monitoring vendor performance. Organizational change management experience, including communications planning, to drive increased adoption levels with new technology deployments to increase the organization's productivity, collaboration, communication, and user satisfaction. The employee shall perform other duties as assigned.
specialized: You must demonstrate in your resume at least one (1) year of qualifying experience equivalent to at least the GS-13 level in the Federal service obtained in either the private or public sector, performing the following types of tasks: experience with identity, credential and access management (ICAM) principles, requirements, tools and technologies, conducting research and analysis on security controls that affect the confidentiality, integrity and availability of IT services and ensure services meet the current and future business requirements to extend, enhance and or optimize services. The ideal candidate will have Experience with Microsoft Outlook for Microsoft 365. Experience with the entire MS365 suite of applications to include but not limited to Teams, SharePoint Online, OneDrive, Exchange Online, Microsoft Active Directory Online/Onsite. Experience in creating and configuring Microsoft 365 tenants. Experience with managing data in M365 to include data retention, sensitivity labeling, Data Loss Prevention and eDiscovery. Experience in project management leading M365 projects. Understanding of Microsoft MDM tools - Intune, Azure Identity and Rights Management, Enterprise Mobility + Security. Strong understanding of ITIL. Organizational change management experience to include large-scale implementation projects designed to increase productivity, collaboration, and communication.

summary: This position is with the First Responder Network Authority (FirstNet Authority), an independent authority within the National Telecommunications and Information Administration. Come join the FirstNet Authority team and make a difference in Public Safety.

summary: As an IT Specialist (INFOSEC), you will serve as a program expert on Federal Public Key Infrastructure matters and Personal Identity Verification card issues. The information provided is the basis for needed strategies, processes, and methods to increase the cost­-effectiveness of Federal identity and security policy implementation in support of the Homeland Security Presidential Directive (HSPD­12). Develop ideas and recommendations that impact IT security policy formulation and technical implementation actions related to identity, credential and access management issues and extends to information and system architectures, IT security policies and standards, business processes, secure delivery of digital services and related IT security practices, tools, controls, and system interoperability across the Federal government and industry. As an IT Specialist (Infosec) you will (1) Oversee and manage multiple IT projects that require a broad range of knowledge in cloud security architecture across various platforms and cybersecurity solutions. (2) Provide technical guidance to CFTC leadership regarding the interpretation, application, and implementation of Zero Trust services, including existing, newly developed, or acquired automated systems. (3) Architect the design and implementation of all Identity, Credential, and Access Management (ICAM) and supporting activities in line with CFTC’s ICAM vision and goals.
specialized: To qualify for the CT-14 level you must have at least one year of specialized experience equivalent to the next lower grade (GS/CT-13 level). Specialized experience is defined that through which one has gained mastery of information security theories and concepts, practices, and the total infrastructure protection environment sufficient to technically support the implementation of security technologies and solutions across cloud platforms to build a robust security architecture. Plan and conduct feasibility studies and advise management and other executives on near and long-term technology changes pertaining to ICAM and Zero Trust technologies.

There may or may not be actual vacancies filled from this flyer.
duties: (1) Serves the Team Lead as a technical expert with the ability to direct and oversee a workforce that is responsible for Identity, Credential, Access Management (ICAM), Public Key Infrastructure (PKI). (2) Dynamic Access Control for Tactical (DACT), Zero Trust, Tactical Hardening for Quantum, testing of possible technologies to meet requirements, and Research and Development associated with tactical implementation. (3) Engages with customer organizations to ensure high customer satisfaction and maintains effective working relationships with customer organizations and leaders. (8) Researches, interprets and applies policies, directives, and regulatory guidance in the ICAM field. (9) Provides guidance/technical evaluation of ICAM related technologies for implementation in a tactical environment.
specialized: To qualify for this position, your resume must describe at least one year of specialized experience equivalent to the next lower grade level (DE-02 or GS-11) or equivalent pay band in the Federal service which includes one or more of the following: 1) Providing technical guidance to customers, subordinates, or peers; 2) Planning/directing programs or projects; 3) Evaluating engineering/scientific data for use in program/project improvement or troubleshooting; and 4) Conduct design or development for a supported technical program. This definition of specialized experience is typical of work performed at the next lower pay band/grade level position in the federal service (DE-02/GS-11).

title: Supervisory IT Specialist (INFOSEC)

summary: As an Supervisory IT Specialist (INFOSEC) you will work with the Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) to oversee the GSA cybersecurity policy and strategy.
duties: (1) Serves as a key member of the OCISO Leadership team and subject matter expert in cybersecurity, making substantial contributions to the annual and long-range planning and cybersecurity program development, operating policy, advanced technologies research and application, organization enhancements, and internal and external coordination; (2) Provides agency-wide leadership, coordination, and technical guidance for the introduction and management of agency-wide IT Security initiatives; (3) Provides direction for the development of strategic and annual plans, policies and standards to institute a comprehensive security architecture that will satisfy Agency information security requirements now and in the foreseeable future that are relevant and achievable in GSA`s modern, digital and cloud focused environment; (4) Interprets all Federal and agency IT security policies for the Agency; (5) Responsible for the GSA cybersecurity risk management program including identification, review and tracking of enterprise cybersecurity risks, assess capabilities, prioritize security and risk strategies, and communicate risk intelligence in a way that drives business decision-making; (6) Provides technical and supervisory guidance for staff; (7) Supervises OCISO Division Directors (Direct supervision of ICAM Division, Policy and Compliance Division, and ISSO Support Services Division) and the program activities delivered therein; (8) Runs the information security function when the CISO is unavailable and must be able to function as the CISO during those times and crisis situations; (9) Manages, supervises, and directs a staff of government personnel and contractors. Identifies and facilitates OCISO goals and objectives. One or more positions may be filled using the vacancy announcement.
specialized: Specialized experience includes (1) Directing and implementing efficient and cost effective information security practices to improve reliability and security; (2) serving as a recognized expert on information security committees; (3) evaluating IT Security requirements and developing evaluation plans; (4) researching information security trends and forecasting additional security needs and requirements; (5) Demonstrates mastery knowledge of, and skill in applying, IT security laws, regulations, theories, concepts, practices, principles, and emerging issues; (6) project management methods and concepts sufficient to plan and coordinate agency wide implementation of Governmentwide and GSA IT security defense strategies to ensure protection of the GSA information and information system resources; (7) Demonstrates mastery knowledge of, and skill in applying, advanced management and organizational theories, principles, concepts, and methodologies to strategically manage and provide security leadership and guidance.

As an IT Program Manager at the GS-2210-14 some of your typical work assignments may include; (1) Leads support for planning, development, and implementation of improvements in information technology services, capabilities, and data standards in support of assigned programs within the DMDC service catalogue; (2) Responsible for developing policies, procedures, and strategies governing the planning and delivery of services and providing expert technical advice, guidance, and recommendations to management and other technical specialists on critical DMDC Program issues; (3) Defines requirements and coordinates with product managers for assigned system projects throughout the systems life cycle from technical solution development, system design and testing, fielding, operations/sustainment, through the retirement/replacement phases; (4) Oversees the implementation of plans, procurements, risks, and deliverables of program elements; develops and tracks performance metrics and provides regular program-level status updates; (5) Manages and evaluates the requirements development process to mitigate impact on cost, schedule, and performance. Assesses the value and organizational impact of projects, ensuring that the target benefits are measurable and related to business goals. Monitors and reports progress and performance of the program related projects with regard to scope, schedule, cost, resource, quality and risk.
specialized: One year of specialized experience equivalent to the GS-13 grade level in the Federal service; (1) Direct experience with cloud-based technology, cloud migrations, and technology modernization; (2) Leads support for planning, development, and implementation of improvements in Identity, Credential, and Access Management (ICAM) programs and applications; (3)Serves as a Program Manager/Customer Relationship Manager for both major and minor IT programs; (4) Leads support for planning, development, and implementation of improvements in information technology services, capabilities, and data standards with an emphasis on Zero Trust concepts.

title: Assistant Director, Information Security - Division of Information Technology
org: Federal Reserve Board - Board of Governors
division: n/a
summary: The Federal Reserve System is the central bank of the United States. It was founded by Congress in 1913 to provide the nation with a safer, more flexible, and more stable monetary and financial system.
duties: I. JOB SPECIFIC DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES; (1) Reporting to the deputy associate director, provides enterprise-level technical, operational, and consulting support and services to Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System (Board) Information Security and Identity, Credential & Access Management (ICAM) Programs; (2) Develops and implements enterprise information security strategies in order to maintain a robust information security posture under an evolving threat landscape; (3) Directly manages multiple units, consisting of managers and analysts. Provides developmental opportunities for managers and staff and works to increase organizational productivity; (4) Maintains strategic partnerships with stakeholders across the Board, the Federal Reserve Banks, and other Central Banks, represents the Board to ensure maximum collaboration and alignment with information security objectives, standards, and strategies; (5) Maintains awareness of the current legislative and government operational requirements such as Presidential Executive Orders, OMB guidance, CISA directives, and ensures the Board complies with government-wide standards and deadlines; (6) Provides strategic leadership to various enterprise and division operational and architectural committees on behalf of Board IT; (7) Maintains a portfolio of information security toolsets to identify security weakness, potentially malicious activity, and opportunities to reduce the Board's attack surface; (8) Adapts cybersecurity strategies to changes in emerging technologies such as information hybrid and multi-cloud environments and zero trust architecture; (9) Develops security metrics and dashboards in order to provide awareness to senior leadership on the Board's information security posture as well as in response to unplanned events and activities including those pertaining to incident response and resiliency. II. DIVISION SPECIFIC REQUIREMENTS; (10) The IT Division meets its mission by managing its services and operations according to four primary business lines; managing the Board's information security program, providing a technology infrastructure, developing custom software and applications, and directing the Board's and System's Statistics functions, with Administration and IT Strategy and Business Partnership serving as supporting business lines which interact with all of the other four business lines. The assistant director is expected to have a fundamental knowledge of each of these business lines and how they are integrated to support the entire lifecycle of data at the Board. The assistant director provides executive leadership to the IT Division's Technology Management Committee and contributes to the execution of strategies set by the IT Division's Process Management and Staff Management Committees. Understands the strategic direction of System IT and works collaboratively with colleagues at Reserve Banks and National IT in support of national lines of business.
specialized: III. KNOWLEDGE/SKILL/EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS; (1) Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field. Advanced degree preferred; (2) 10 years of related technical experience including 3 years of experience managing people; (3) Experience in leading information security and/or ICAM operations capabilities and in developing implementing information security strategies; (4) Experience implementing information security tools under a mission critical complex architectural environment supporting thousands of users and endpoints; (5) Experience developing information security strategies through a project lifecycle; (6) Experience with conflict mediation; (7) Experience overseeing a complex portfolio of operational toolsets; (8) Experience and commitment to fostering collaboration and employee engagement, building high performing teams, diminishing organizational silos, strengthening teams, and facilitating effective group and team dynamics; (9) Experience leading and managing staff and projects effectively, setting priorities, assessing performance, guiding staff development, and making budgetary recommendations; (10) Ability to balance competing interests among a variety of clients and readily readjust priorities to respond to pressing and changing client demands. Must be able to anticipate and meet the clients' needs while maintaining high-quality end products; (11) Exceptional organization savvy and agility as demonstrated by ability to manage across organizational boundaries; (12) Requires the ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing, with all levels of staff and management.

title: IT Cybersecurity Specialist (CUSTSPT/INFOSEC)
division: United States Coast Guard (USCG), Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Cyber and Intelligence Service Center (C5ISC), Infrastructure Services Division, Infrastructure Management Systems Branch (IMS)
summary: This position is located in the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), United States Coast Guard (USCG), Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Cyber and Intelligence Service Center (C5ISC), Infrastructure Services Division, Infrastructure Management Systems Branch (IMS), Alexandria VA.
duties: You will serves as an Information Technology (IT) Cybersecurity Specialist (CUSTSPT/INFOSEC) and be responsible for managing the package of support functions required to field and maintain the readiness and operational capability of systems and components. Being a CG civilian makes you a valuable member of the CG team.  Typical work assignments include; (1) Providing advice on project costs, design concepts, or design changes; (2) Gathering feedback on customer satisfaction and internal service performance to foster continual improvement, ongoing optimization, and problem-solving support; (3) Reviewing service performance reports identifying any significant issues and variances, initiating, where necessary, corrective actions and providing input to implementation plans and standard operating procedures; (4) Applying cybersecurity functions (e.g., encryption, access control, and identity management) to reduce exploitation opportunities; (5) Monitoring and auditing the schedule, cost, design, analysis, operational performance and/or internal security procedures of national security systems (NSS) and respective classified information, critical infrastructure, mission essential systems (MES), high value assets (HVA) or other USCG information systems; (6) Assisting with the negotiation for acceptance of agency positions on key Government-wide policy initiatives exercising independent judgment and discretion with DoD, DHS, OMB on national security systems (NSS) and respective classified information, critical infrastructure, mission essential systems (MES), high value assets (HVA) or other USCG information systems, including advance information of management`s position with regard to IT cyber contract negotiations, IT cyber acquisitions, cyber security continuous diagnostics and monitoring.
specialized: To qualify at the GS-11 grade level, applicants must have at least one full year of specialized experience equivalent to at least the GS-09 grade level in the federal sector.  Specialized experience may include the following; (1) Supporting key projects within the Identity, Credentialing, and Access Management (ICAM) arena to maintain cost, schedule, and performance affecting an organization's systems; (2) Support daily activities of contractor personnel and report findings to Contracting officer; (3) Conducting system engineering IAW one of the following Information Technology Service Management (ITSM), DoD Enterprise Service Management Framework, and Systems Engineering Life Cycle (SELC) practices; (4) Conducting analysis and providing recommendations to develop, release, evaluate and execute Statement of Works (SOWs), Statement of Objectives (SOOs), Request for Information (RFI) and, Request for Proposals (RFPs); (5) Tracking integrated master schedules, key milestones, and critical paths through appropriate automated tools and processes; (6) Supporting project managers using one of the following AGILE/SCRUM/DEVSECOPS methodologies; (7) OR Applicants may substitute successful completion of 3 years of progressively higher level graduate education or Ph.D. or equivalent graduate degree (such as an LL.M, if related); (8) OR A combination of appropriate specialized experience (as described above) and graduate education (as described above) that is beyond the second year of progressive graduate study to meet the qualification requirements. To qualify at the GS-12 or GS-13 grade level, applicants must have at least one full year of specialized experience equivalent to at least the GS-12 grade level in the federal sector.  Specialized experience may include the following; (1) Leading key projects within the ICAM arena to maintain cost, schedule, and performance affecting an organization's systems; (2) Overseeing and monitoring daily activities of contractor personnel and report findings to Contracting Officer; (3) Conducting system engineering IAW one of the following ITSM, DoD Enterprise Service Management Framework, and SELC practices; (4) Conducting analysis and providing recommendation(s) to develop, release, evaluate and execute SOWs, SOOs, RFI and, RFPs; (5) Overseeing and tracking integrated master schedules, key milestones, and critical paths through appropriate automated tools and processes; (6) Conducting project management using AGILE/SCRUM/DEVSECOPS methodologies.

title: Information Technology Specialist (Cyber)
division: Directorate of Cybersecurity, Division of Security Operations Center (SOC) Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO) Office of the Assistant Secretary for Administration and Management
summary: The Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO) is a customer service organization dedicated to providing information technology (IT) solutions and leadership to advance DOLs mission.  More information on the OCIO is available on our website, LinkedIn, and Twitter accounts. Position is outside of the bargaining unit. Recruitment incentives may be considered.
duties: This position is located in the Department of Labor (DOL), Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO), Directorate of Cybersecurity, Division of Security Operations Center (SOC). The directorate under the direction of the Departments Chief Information Security Officer (CISO) is responsible for managing the Department-wide cyber security program. This includes the review and approval of information assurance policies, standards, and guidelines. Developing guidelines for system security plans. Providing alignment with all information security-related national directives and Departmental policies and ensuring that all staff receives the appropriate security awareness training for their specific roles. These policies, standards, and guidelines are designed to protect all Department of Labor information and information systems from threats, both internal and external. Furthermore, under the cybersecurity directorate also establishes and manages the Departments Security Operations Center (SOC), which is responsible for independent department-wide security monitoring, design and coordinated incident response. The incumbent serves as a technical subject matter expert for the DOL cybersecurity team on security issues, and as such, is a recognized authority on technologies impacting the Departments computer security program. The incumbent is also charged with the Department advancement in security technology, monitoring and response activities supporting the Departments mission. The incumbent of this position will serve as a project/team leader within the Division of Security Operations, providing authoritative expert advice to top-level DOL officials. The incumbent regularly deals with information that demands a high level of public trust with access to sensitive/confidential data and will be required to obtain the required Top-Secret security clearance. Major duties include; (1) Leads in the design and review of enterprise-wide Cybersecurity programs that will keep pace with today’s threat environment. Examples under this are but not limited to the advancement and adoption towards Zero Trust Architecture, Secure Cloud Services, Software Supply Chain Security and Investigative and Remediation Capabilities. (2) Provides technical oversight for the development of short and tong-range system security plans and Federal security compliance activities. Provides continuous oversight and management of the Departments security event monitoring and response program supporting the Department. Coordinates work with Agency staff responsible for the design and implementation of IT technology. Provides continuous oversight and management of the Departments security event monitoring and response program supporting the Departments major information and general support systems in an integrated environment. coordinates work with OCIO and DOL staff. (3) Keeps abreast of state-of-the-art security technologies, including biometrics, public and private key cryptography, intrusion detection, and Internet/Intranet security technologies for use and deployment in the Department. (4) Develops specifications and design, and provides detailed evaluations, justifications, and recommendations pertinent to the procurement of network security equipment, software, and services that support the department’s security requirements, efficiencies, and approaches to enhance security functionality for the network, while not reducing system efficiencies. Prepares documentation for distribution to Department staff and other facilities personnel concerning changes affecting the security environment.
specialized: Applicants must have 52 weeks of specialized experience equivalent to at least the next lower grade level, GS-13, in the Federal Service. Specialized experience is (1) experience as a Subject Matter Expert that leads enterprise-wide IT Security projects. (2) Provides technical oversight in the configuring and deploying a broad array of security tools. (3) experience in designing security solutions leveraging knowledge of infrastructure, trusted applications, continuous monitoring proper implementation of security appliances and protecting on-prem and cloud-based systems. (4) Experience in the development activities surrounding zero trust pillars, frameworks and implementation strategies particularly in visibility/analytics and automation/orchestration.

title: IT Specialist (INFOSEC)
division: Office of Governmentwide Policy, Office of Technology Policy, Identity Assurance and Trusted Access Division
summary: As a IT Specialist (INFOSEC), you will responsible for directing, coordinating, and overseeing interagency efforts to implement cybersecurity, zero trust, and the Federal Identity, Credential, and Access Management (FICAM) architecture.
duties: As IT Specialist (INFOSEC) you will (1) Lead government-wide efforts to identify needed areas of policy and implementation improvement to ensure that Federal IT systems and other resources are being managed in a secure, reliable, and cost-effective manner consistent with cybersecurity and FICAM policy goals. (2) Provide IT security leadership, expert technical assistance, and authoritative advice on interpreting IT security policies and practices relating to the Federal Information Security Management Act (FISMA), OMB Circulars, NIST guidelines and requirements, and other pertinent Federal IT security standards and requirements. (3) Formulates IT security policy recommendations for cybersecurity-related initiatives to plan, develop, and implement innovative Government-wide cybersecurity policies, technical implementation guidance and best practices across the Federal government. (4) Lead and/or participates in interagency information cybersecurity committees and councils and is recognized as a technical cybersecurity expert and authority in the related areas of cybersecurity.
specialized: Experience applying IT security policies, concepts, and practices and emerging issues, and project management methods and concepts sufficient to planning, coordinating and implement agency wide IT security strategies and programs to ensure protection of IT assets and infrastructure; evaluate alternative solutions to emerging cybersecurity issues; develop and lead IT security initiatives and provide program management and oversight; research issues relating to IT security and identity and access management for organizational policy updates.

title: IT Specialist (INFOSEC)
division: Division of Information Technology, Chief Information Officer Organization, HQ
summary: This position is located in the Division of Information Technology, Chief Information Officer Organization, HQ, Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation and serves as Senior IT Specialist in the Network Services Unit (NSU) within the Infrastructure and Operations Services Branch (IOSB), Core Infrastructure Services Section (CISS).
duties: (1) Leads the evaluation, design, selection, and implementation of on premise or cloud-based multi-vendor network and security solutions throughout the enterprise to include LAN, MAN, WAN, remote access, wireless, next generation firewalls, Intrusion Detection System /Intrusion Prevention System (IDS/IPS), load balancing and application delivery, authentication, encryption, and orchestration. Defines network monitoring and reporting requirements. Analyzes and recommends selection of hardware and software technologies and processes most suited to the requirements of the Corporation. (2) Directs and guides in the gathering of on premise or cloud-based hardware and software requirements for new initiatives, and evaluating and testing computer and software products to determine which products best meet the IT requirements of the Corporation and enhance the Corporation's information security posture.  Consults with Cloud Architecture team to determine network and security requirements including Trusted Internet Connection (TIC) and Cloud Log Aggregation Warehouse. (3) Leads complex network and security infrastructure endeavors such as Zero Trust Architecture (ZTA) to include encrypted DNS, microsegmentation, and Zero Trust Network Access (ZTNA), cloud integration, capacity planning as it relates to on-premise, cloud, and hybrid cloud infrastructures, IPv6, and continuous improvement of the remote user experience. (4) Ensures the rigorous application of information security, information assurance policies, principles, and practices in the delivery of all network services to safeguard the FDIC internal and external networks in support of the FDIC core business.
specialized: n/a

title: Information Technology Specialist
division: Federal Emergency Management Agency

title: IT Specialist (INFOSEC)
division: National Telecommunications and Information Administration, FirstNet Authority
summary: This position is with the First Responder Network Authority (FirstNet Authority), an independent authority within the National Telecommunications and Information Administration. Come join the FirstNet Authority team and make a difference in public safety.
duties: (1) Serves a as an Information Technology (IT) Security Systems Administrator under the IT Security Division within the Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO) within the FirstNet Authority. (3) Oral communication Serving as a subject matter expert pertaining to computer, network and systems security (4) Problem Solving Implementing security hardening and vulnerability management to affected systems to remedy security and other vulnerabilities in accordance with IT security best practices. Specialized Experience ZP-IV (GS-13/14). To qualify for the ZP-IV (GS-13/14) you must possess at least one year of specialized experience at or equivalent to the GS-12 grade level or ZP-III pay band in the Federal service or equivalent experience in the private or public sector performing all of the following (1) Implementing and managing enterprise-wide IT security toolset solutions, such as Tenable, FireEye, LogRhythm, McAfee CASB. (2) Configuring IT security systems, analyzing security requirements, and recommending improvements for the overall infrastructure. (3) Conducting vulnerability management and implementation of DISA STIGs to ensure the proper defenses are integrated to minimize security breaches. duties: One or more positions may be filled using the vacancy announcement. Incumbents will be responsible for one or more of the following duties. (1) Responsible for the governance of the Identity, Credential and Access Management (ICAM) Shared Services Portfolio. (2) Responsible for Information Security tasks and functions to ensure agency-level compliance and improve the security of GSA information systems. (3) Responsible for operationalizing the ecosystem of Cyber risk management dashboards at GSA and developing methods to monitor and measure risk, compliance, and assurance efforts. (4) Ability to coordinate Security Operations Center effort across multiple teams across an Enterprise organization. (5) Manage the ICAM Program within the ICAM Shared Services Division, including development of any related policies, procedures, and processes. (6) Coordinate and provide technical support to enterprise-wide cyber defense technicians to resolve cyber defense incidents.
